description: For bases b = 2, 3, ..., n, let the base-b expansion of n be [c_{1,b} c_{2,b} .. c_{r_b,b}], with the most significant "digit" on the left, 0 <= c_{i,b} < b, and c_{1,b} != 0; then a(n) is the number whose base-n expansion is c_{1,n} c_{2,n} ... c_{r_n,n} c_{1,n-1} ... c_{1,2} c_{2,2} ... c_{r_2,2}.
